title: Memory Market Uprising
outcome: Residents in Halden Zones create 'Memory Markets' to reclaim histories erased by system failures and Council information control. Trading in hand-written stories and art, they resist digital oversight and inspire mass participation even outside the liberated areas. The Council's attempts to regulate or infiltrate the markets only fuel the movement, leaving the city's grip on memory and identity more fragile than ever.

events.description: Residents in Halden Zones set up 'Memory Markets,' where people gather to share hand-written diaries, artwork, and exchanged stories erased from digital records.
Council attempts to regulate the markets as 'unauthorized gatherings,' but discovery of agents attempting to infiltrate only spurs more citizens to participate.
Memory Markets inspire copycat events in controlled zones, spreading the movement citywide—participants openly challenge official histories and BCI's data-driven narratives.
Council factions privately admit their authority is undermined as increasing numbers of citizens rely on non-digital networks for information and community.
